PageTitle: radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet
FuncDef:
The radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet command enables a device to adjust the sending of RADIUS real-time accounting packets based on the system status.
The undo radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device stops sending RADIUS real-time accounting packets when the main control board's memory usage reaches 85%.
CLIs: radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet
undo radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet
Examples: [~HUAWEI] radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet
ExtraInfo: In RADIUS accounting scenarios with a large number of online users, when the memory usage of the device has reached 85% but more users are going online, run the radius-server send adjust system-state optimize accounting-interim-packet command to allow the device to continue sending RADIUS real-time accounting packets until the memory usage reaches a value of restart threshold - 1%.
